summary.long: 1 Peter is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text:
Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ,
To the pilgrims of the Dispersion in Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, in sanctification of the Spirit, for obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ:
Grace to you and peace be multiplied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who according to His abundant mercy has begotten us again to a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to an inheritance incorruptible and undefiled and that does not fade away, reserved in heaven for you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who are kept by the power of God through faith for salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this you greatly rejoice, though now for a little while, if need be, you have been grieved by various trials,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the genuineness of your faith, being much more precious than gold that perishes, though it is tested by fire, may be found to praise, honor, and glory at the revelation of Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom having not seen you love. Though now you do not see Him, yet believing, you rejoice with joy inexpressible and full of glory,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: receiving the end of your faith—the salvation of your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of this salvation the prophets have inquired and searched carefully, who prophesied of the grace that would come to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: searching what, or what manner of time, the Spirit of Christ who was in them was indicating when He testified beforehand the sufferings of Christ and the glories that would follow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To them it was revealed that, not to themselves, but to us they were ministering the things which now have been reported to you through those who have preached the gospel to you by the Holy Spirit sent from heaven—things which angels desire to look into.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore gird up the loins of your mind, be sober, and rest your hope fully upon the grace that is to be brought to you at the revelation of Jesus Christ;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as obedient children, not conforming yourselves to the former lusts, as in your ignorance;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but as He who called you is holy, you also be holy in all your conduct,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because it is written, “Be holy, for I am holy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you call on the Father, who without partiality judges according to each one’s work, conduct yourselves throughout the time of your stay here in fear;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: knowing that you were not redeemed with corruptible things, like silver or gold, from your aimless conduct received by tradition from your fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but with the precious blood of Christ, as of a lamb without blemish and without spot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He indeed was foreordained before the foundation of the world, but was manifest in these last times for you
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who through Him believe in God, who raised Him from the dead and gave Him glory, so that your faith and hope are in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since you have purified your souls in obeying the truth through the Spirit in sincere love of the brethren, love one another fervently with a pure heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having been born again, not of corruptible seed but incorruptible, through the word of God which lives and abides forever,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because
“All flesh is as grass,
And all the glory of man as the flower of the grass.
The grass withers,
And its flower falls away,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the word of the Lord endures forever.”
Now this is the word which by the gospel was preached to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, laying aside all malice, all deceit, hypocrisy, envy, and all evil speaking,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as newborn babes, desire the pure milk of the word, that you may grow thereby,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if indeed you have tasted that the Lord is gracious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Coming to Him as to a living stone, rejected indeed by men, but chosen by God and precious,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you also, as living stones, are being built up a spiritual house, a holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore it is also contained in the Scripture,
“Behold, I lay in Zion
A chief cornerstone, elect, precious,
And he who believes on Him will by no means be put to shame.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, to you who believe, He is precious; but to those who are disobedient,
“The stone which the builders rejected
Has become the chief cornerstone,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and
“A stone of stumbling
And a rock of offense.”
They stumble, being disobedient to the word, to which they also were appointed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you are a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, His own special people, that you may proclaim the praises of Him who called you out of darkness into His marvelous light;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who once were not a people but are now the people of God, who had not obtained mercy but now have obtained mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beloved, I beg you as sojourners and pilgrims, abstain from fleshly lusts which war against the soul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having your conduct honorable among the Gentiles, that when they speak against you as evildoers, they may, by your good works which they observe, glorify God in the day of visitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore submit yourselves to every ordinance of man for the Lord’s sake, whether to the king as supreme,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or to governors, as to those who are sent by him for the punishment of evildoers and for the praise of those who do good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is the will of God, that by doing good you may put to silence the ignorance of foolish men—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as free, yet not using liberty as a cloak for vice, but as bondservants of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Honor all people. Love the brotherhood. Fear God. Honor the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Servants, be submissive to your masters with all fear, not only to the good and gentle, but also to the harsh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is commendable, if because of conscience toward God one endures grief, suffering wrongfully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what credit is it if, when you are beaten for your faults, you take it patiently? But when you do good and suffer, if you take it patiently, this is commendable before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For to this you were called, because Christ also suffered for us, leaving us an example, that you should follow His steps:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Who committed no sin,
Nor was deceit found in His mouth”;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who, when He was reviled, did not revile in return; when He suffered, He did not threaten, but committed Himself to Him who judges righteously;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who Himself bore our sins in His own body on the tree, that we, having died to sins, might live for righteousness—by whose stripes you were healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you were like sheep going astray, but have now returned to the Shepherd and Overseer of your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wives, likewise, be submissive to your own husbands, that even if some do not obey the word, they, without a word, may be won by the conduct of their wives,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when they observe your chaste conduct accompanied by fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not let your adornment be merely outward—arranging the hair, wearing gold, or putting on fine apparel—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: rather let it be the hidden person of the heart, with the incorruptible beauty of a gentle and quiet spirit, which is very precious in the sight of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in this manner, in former times, the holy women who trusted in God also adorned themselves, being submissive to their own husbands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as Sarah obeyed Abraham, calling him lord, whose daughters you are if you do good and are not afraid with any terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Husbands, likewise, dwell with them with understanding, giving honor to the wife, as to the weaker vessel, and as being heirs together of the grace of life, that your prayers may not be hindered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, all of you be of one mind, having compassion for one another; love as brothers, be tenderhearted, be courteous;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not returning evil for evil or reviling for reviling, but on the contrary blessing, knowing that you were called to this, that you may inherit a blessing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For
“He who would love life
And see good days,
Let him refrain his tongue from evil,
And his lips from speaking deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let him turn away from evil and do good;
Let him seek peace and pursue it.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: And who is he who will harm you if you become followers of what is good?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even if you should suffer for righteousness’ sake, you are blessed. “And do not be afraid of their threats, nor be troubled.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts, and always be ready to give a defense to everyone who asks you a reason for the hope that is in you, with meekness and fear;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having a good conscience, that when they defame you as evildoers, those who revile your good conduct in Christ may be ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is better, if it is the will of God, to suffer for doing good than for doing evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Christ also suffered once for sins, the just for the unjust, that He might bring us to God, being put to death in the flesh but made alive by the Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by whom also He went and preached to the spirits in prison,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who formerly were disobedient, when once the Divine longsuffering waited in the days of Noah, while the ark was being prepared, in which a few, that is, eight souls, were saved through water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is also an antitype which now saves us—baptism (not the removal of the filth of the flesh, but the answer of a good conscience toward God), through the resurrection of Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who has gone into heaven and is at the right hand of God, angels and authorities and powers having been made subject to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, since Christ suffered for us in the flesh, arm yourselves also with the same mind, for he who has suffered in the flesh has ceased from sin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that he no longer should live the rest of his time in the flesh for the lusts of men, but for the will of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we have spent enough of our past lifetime in doing the will of the Gentiles—when we walked in lewdness, lusts, drunkenness, revelries, drinking parties, and abominable idolatries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In regard to these, they think it strange that you do not run with them in the same flood of dissipation, speaking evil of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will give an account to Him who is ready to judge the living and the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason the gospel was preached also to those who are dead, that they might be judged according to men in the flesh, but live according to God in the spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the end of all things is at hand; therefore be serious and watchful in your prayers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And above all things have fervent love for one another, for “love will cover a multitude of sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be hospitable to one another without grumbling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As each one has received a gift, minister it to one another, as good stewards of the manifold grace of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone speaks, let him speak as the oracles of God. If anyone ministers, let him do it as with the ability which God supplies, that in all things God may be glorified through Jesus Christ, to whom belong the glory and the dominion forever and ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beloved, do not think it strange concerning the fiery trial which is to try you, as though some strange thing happened to you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but rejoice to the extent that you partake of Christ’s sufferings, that when His glory is revealed, you may also be glad with exceeding joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you are reproached for the name of Christ, blessed are you, for the Spirit of glory and of God rests upon you. On their part He is blasphemed, but on your part He is glorified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But let none of you suffer as a murderer, a thief, an evildoer, or as a busybody in other people’s matters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet if anyone suffers as a Christian, let him not be ashamed, but let him glorify God in this matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the time has come for judgment to begin at the house of God; and if it begins with us first, what will be the end of those who do not obey the gospel of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now
“If the righteous one is scarcely saved,
Where will the ungodly and the sinner appear?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore let those who suffer according to the will of God commit their souls to Him in doing good, as to a faithful Creator.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The elders who are among you I exhort, I who am a fellow elder and a witness of the sufferings of Christ, and also a partaker of the glory that will be revealed:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shepherd the flock of God which is among you, serving as overseers, not by compulsion but willingly, not for dishonest gain but eagerly;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor as being lords over those entrusted to you, but being examples to the flock;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when the Chief Shepherd appears, you will receive the crown of glory that does not fade away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Likewise you younger people, submit yourselves to your elders. Yes, all of you be submissive to one another, and be clothed with humility, for
“God resists the proud,
But gives grace to the humble.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore humble yourselves under the mighty hand of God, that He may exalt you in due time,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: casting all your care upon Him, for He cares for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be sober, be vigilant; because your adversary the devil walks about like a roaring lion, seeking whom he may devour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Resist him, steadfast in the faith, knowing that the same sufferings are experienced by your brotherhood in the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But may the God of all grace, who called us to His eternal glory by Christ Jesus, after you have suffered a while, perfect, establish, strengthen, and settle you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Him be the glory and the dominion forever and ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By Silvanus, our faithful brother as I consider him, I have written to you briefly, exhorting and testifying that this is the true grace of God in which you stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She who is in Babylon, elect together with you, greets you; and so does Mark my son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Greet one another with a kiss of love.
Peace to you all who are in Christ Jesus. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
